morning:intro:1.message: It is time for your morning messages to highlight the positive aspects of your caregiving and provide some encouraging words to start the day!

morning:gen_message:1.message: Good Morning, [caregiver name]. If at any time you feel that you or [care recipient name] are unsafe or need help, please follow your emergency plan.

morning:positive:reflection:1.message: What has been rewarding about your caregiving?

morning:positive:reflection:2.message: What do you most look forward to/enjoy/value about taking care of your loved one?

morning:positive:reflection:3.message: What are some good memories of your loved one that you can draw on to keep you going?

morning:positive:reflection:4.message: What kind of meaning do you find in caregiving?

morning:positive:general:1.message: [MM] You're providing a familiar/secure/routine/pleasant environment for [care recipient name].

morning:positive:general:2.message: [MM] You know [care recipient name] best and will be able to identify subtle differences in their well-being.

morning:positive:general:3.message: [MM] You know [care recipient name] best and can create meaningful and engaging activities that are best suited for him/her personally.

morning:positive:general:4.message: [MM] Look at your card to send your intention for today

morning:positive:general:5.message: [MM] Think about what's important to you today. Look at the card if it would help.

morning:positive:general:6.message: [MM] Caring for [care recipient name] is allowing you to spend quality/important time with [care recipient name].

morning:positive:general:7.message: [MM] Your providing a familiar environment for your loved one during a difficult time.

morning:positive:general:8.message: [MM] Take a moment now to reflect on the following question: [MRM]

morning:positive:accomp:1.message: [MM] You have developed many useful and creative skills by caring for your loved one.

morning:positive:accomp:2.message: [MM] Caring for your loved one can help improve their well-being.

morning:positive:feeling:1.message: [MM] As their caregiver, you are providing an important companionship for your loved one.

morning:positive:feeling:2.message: [MM] Caregiving has allowed you to return the love and care you have received from [care recipient name] over the years.

morning:positive:feeling:3.message: [MM] Your care has allowed [care recipient name]'s to preserve a sense of self-identity.

morning:positive:feeling:4.message: [MM] You're following through on the promises you made in your wedding vows.

morning:positive:family:1.message: [MM] You are an excellent role-model for your children.

morning:positive:family:2.message: [MM] Your children appreciate the care you provide for [care recipient name].

morning:positive:family:3.message: [MM] You are setting a fantastic example of how to love and care for family.

morning:positive:growth:1.message: [MM] Even though this has been challenging, you have been so strong.

morning:positive:growth:2.message: [MM] You have overcome so much through this, and you're still going!

morning:positive:growth:3.message: [MM] Through caregiving you have strengthened your patience and ability to care for others' needs.

morning:positive:growth:4.message: [MM] You have strengthened your ability to juggle many things at once by caring for [care recipient name].

morning:encouragement:general:1.message:
You did a great job keeping yourself calm yesterday. [B] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:general:2.message:
Self-care means learning how to give the best version of yourself to the people who depend on you. [B] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:general:3.message:
Stress tries to stop you from giving your best to your loved ones - and you are learning to reduce its influence on you. [B] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:general:4.message:
[B] Great job keeping your emotions under control yesterday. []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:general:5.message:
Your effort is making a bigger difference than you think. [B] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:general:6.message:
Brief moments of self-care are increasing the quality of the care you give. [B] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:general:7.message:
It's hard to care for others when you haven't cared for yourself, and you did a good job caring for yourself yesterday. []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:general:8.message:
[B] It takes extra effort to care for yourself, but this work is making a difference for you and your loved one. []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:success:1.message:
[A] made a big difference for you yesterday. [B] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:success:2.message:
[A] is hard work, but you're learning how to use it when you need it. []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:unsuccess:1.message:
It takes a long time to master a new skill. [C] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:unsuccess:2.message:
Looks like it was difficult to implement [A]. [C] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:unsuccessmult:1.message:
It looks like it was a tough day. And, you were successful in doing [A]. [C] []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:unsuccessmult:2.message:
Notice what's working, [A], and do that more. []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:encouragement:successmult:1.message:
Yesterday seemed like it was really great. Here's one self-care tip that seemed particularly successful for you [A]. []1 Please send more encouraging words
2 Please send more encouraging words later today
3 Thanks!

morning:self_care_goal:1.message:
Setting your Self-Care Goal:

Remember that while you are providing care for a loved one, you also need take care of yourself. Try to take some time now to set a self-care goal for today.

morning:self_care_goal:2.message:
Setting your Self-Care Goal:

Now would be a good time to create a self-care goal for today.

morning:self_care_goal:3.message:
Setting your Self-Care Goal:

Take a moment to set your daily intention to care for yourself in some way.

daytime:check_in:1.message: Can you identify any unmet needs that could be contributing to [care recipient name]'s restlessness? Addressing those needs may help calm him/her down.

daytime:check_in:2.message: It seems like you and [care recipient name] may be experiencing a stressful situation. Address any safety concerns now.

daytime:check_in:3.message: It seems like you and [care recipient name] may be experiencing a stressful situation. Take a moment to scan your current environment for distractions. For example, [distractions]

daytime:check_in:4.message: Take a moment to modify your surroundings to reduce [care recipient name]'s restlessness?

daytime:check_in:5.message: Do a scan of the environment. Are there any stressors that may be escalating your situation? If so, attempt to limit or remove those stressors.

daytime:recomm:timeout:1.message: Now might be a good time to take a brief break.

daytime:recomm:timeout:2.message: Take a quick moment for yourself.

daytime:recomm:timeout:3.message: Take some time to "put on your oxygen mask."

daytime:recomm:timeout:5.message: It seems like this could be a good time to take a time-out.

daytime:recomm:timeout:6.message: Feel free to step away if you need to collect your thoughts.

daytime:recomm:timeout:7.message: Feel free to step away if you need to settle yourself.

daytime:recomm:timeout:8.message: It seems like you could use some uninterrupted personal time, can you engage your loved one in an activity that they enjoy?

daytime:recomm:timeout:9.message: Engage [care recipient name] in an engaging activity and give yourself a few moments of personal time?

daytime:recomm:breathing:4.message: Breathe in through your nose and out through your mouth.

daytime:recomm:breathing:8.message: Try some breathing exercises on your mindfulness training app.

daytime:recomm:bodyscan:2.message: Perform a body scan using your mindfulness training app.

daytime:recomm:enjoyable:1.message: You know [care recipient name] best, what's an activity that he/she has always enjoyed?-included in caregiver training.

daytime:recomm:enjoyable:2.message: Are you able to set up an activity for your loved one now?

daytime:recomm:enjoyable:3.message: Now might be a good time to start an activity with/for your loved one.

daytime:recomm:enjoyable:4.message: You and your loved one may benefit from engaging in an activity that you both enjoy.

daytime:recomm:enjoyable:5.message: Now might be a good time to do something you and [care recipient name] love doing together.

daytime:recomm:enjoyable:6.message: Can you start an activity with/for [care recipient name] that would make you both feel calmer?

daytime:recomm:enjoyable:7.message: Trying engaging [care recipient name] in an activity or task that provides them with a sense of ease.

daytime:postrecomm:implement:1.message: Did you do the stress management tip we sent?

daytime:postrecomm:helpfulyes:1.message: On a scale from 1-10 how helpful was the stress management tip?

daytime:postrecomm:helpfulno:1.message:
What prevented you from doing the stress management tip?[]1 I didn't have time
2 I didn't think it would help
3 I didn't see the message

evening:intro:1.message: We will now review your day. We will ask a few questions about how you are feeling, if you were able to complete your self-care goal, and whether today's stress management tips were helpful.

evening:likert:stress:1.message: On a scale from 1-10, how stressful was your day today?

evening:likert:lonely:1.message: Today, on a scale from 1-10, how lonely did you feel?

evening:likert:health:1.message: On a scale from 1-10, how would you say your physical health is today?

evening:likert:health:2.message: On a scale from 1-10, how would you say your emotional health is today?

evening:daily:goal:1.message: Did you meet your self-care goal for today?

evening:daily:goalno:1.message:
What made it difficult for you to complete your goal?[]1 I didn't have enough time
2 I was too tired or stressed
3 I was distracted by other tasks or activities
4 I did not set a goal

evening:stress:manag:1.message: Did you do a stress management tip today?

evening:stress:managyes:1.message:
Which stress management tip or tips did you do today?[]1 Deep breathing
2 Time out
3 Body Scan
4 Enjoyable Activity

evening:stress:managyes:2.message: On a scale from 0-10, how helpful was the stress management tip?

evening:stress:managno:1.message:
What prevented you from doing the stress management tip(s)?[]1 I didn't have time.
2 I didn't think it would help.
3 I didn't see the message(s).

evening:system:helpful:1.message: On a scale from 1-10, how helpful were today's stress management tips?

evening:system:helpful:2.message:
Which stress management tip helped most?[]1 Body Scan
2 Time out
3 Enjoyable Activity
4 Deep Breathing

evening:system:helpful:3.message:
Did any of the stress management tips help reduce your stress?[]1 Body Scan
2 Time Out
3 Enjoyable Activity
4 Deep Breathing

weekly:survey:1.message:
This week, which tips have been the most helpful?[]1 Body Scan
2 Deep Breathing
3 Enjoyable activities
4 Time Out
5 Reflecting on the positive aspects of caregiving
6 Receiving encouraging words in the morning
7 Setting my morning self-care goal

weekly:messages:1.message: Do you like the number of messages you receive in a day?

weekly:messages:no:1.message:
Would you like:[]1 More Messages
2 Fewer Messages
3 No Change

weekly:msgetime:1.message: Do you still like the amount of time between messages?

weekly:msgetime:no:1.message:
How would you like to change the amount of time?[]1 More time between messages
2 Less time between messages
3 No Change

weekly:startstop:1.message: Do you still like the start and stop time for the messages?

weekly:startstop:start:1.message:
Please choose your preferred start time:[]1 2 hours earlier
2 1.5 hours earlier
3 1 hour earlier
4 30 minutes earlier
5 No Change
6 30 minutes later
7 1 hour later
8 1.5 hours later
9 2 hours later

weekly:startstop:stop:1.message:
Please choose your preferred end time:[]1 2 hours earlier
2 1.5 hours earlier
3 1 hour earlier
4 30 minutes earlier
5 No Change
6 30 minutes later
7 1 hour later
8 1.5 hours later
9 2 hours later

morning:addon:A.enjoyable: Engaging your loved one in a enjoyable activity

morning:addon:B: You are doing a great job.
morning:addon:C: Remember you are doing this for important reasons.
Being a caregiver is hard work.
Not every day will be perfect.
Remember to give yourself a break, too.
Show yourself some kindness and compassion.
recomm:checkin:distract: Do you have a lot of visitors?
Have you had a busy day?
